intro: Angostura glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziovian angel's trumpets, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, while its stems are woody and covered in a rough, hairy texture. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
